subject: Languages
title: How ASL Was Born
description: A 60-second lesson on How ASL Was Born.

hook.text: American Sign Language is a blend of French Sign Language and the signs of Martha's Vineyard.

buildup.text: In 1817, Thomas Gallaudet brought Laurent Clerc, a deaf teacher, from Paris to Hartford, Connecticut.

discovery.text: Clerc's French signs mixed with existing American deaf community signs to create something new.

twist.text: That's why ASL is closer to French Sign Language than to British Sign Language â€” despite the shared English.

climax.text: The American School for the Deaf became ASL's birthplace and standardization center.
